thread.title: PDP committed to work for public welfare: Arif laigaroo
thread.title_full: PDP committed to work for public welfare: Arif laigaroo

author: KNS
title: PDP committed to work for public welfare: Arif laigaroo
text: J&KPDP committed to work for public welfare: Arif laigaroo By KNS Posted on Dec 31, 2023 | Updated on Dec 31, 2023 Share Tweet Share Srinagar Dec 31 (KNS): Reiterating the party's commitment to work for public welfare, senior leader & constituency Incharge Habakadal Arif laigaroo while addressing a well attended party workers meeting of Habakadal today emphasized that Mufti Sahab has laid down a clear path to be adhered to by the party and any one who has compassion for the people of J&K. Laiguroo highlighted the visionary leadership of Mufti Muhammad Sayeed, acknowledging the PDP's role in providing a crucial alternative political platform. He commended Mufti's dedication, noting the significant strides made towards lasting peace in Jammu and Kashmir. He further stressed on how in these testing times for region of J&K particularly for Kashmir it is imperative to strengthen the party that Mufti Sayeed laid the foundation to shape a better future . Laigaroo stressed and appealed the gathering to work in unison and urged the workers to work towards making the upcoming anniversary of Mufti Mohammad Sayeed a grand success. Laigaroo also condemned yesterday's incident in Bafkiaz Poonch in which local administration stopped party president and former Chief Minister Ms Mehbooba Mufti ji to visit the families of three civilians killed last week after picking them for questioning. The meeting was attended by Zone President Sameer Ul jameel, Organising secretary Sheikh Numan, General Secretary Fayaz Rah, Publicity Secretary Sheikh Haroon, Tasaduk, Mir Saleem, and Umer Bashir and others.(KNS) Related Categories:Politics Share Tweet Share Recommended for you Year 2023 Report card: Handwara police registers 50 cases under NDPS Act, attaches properties worth Rs 7 cr IGP Kashmir greets people on New Year Shah-i-Hamdan Sports Academy Sopore Athletes Shine at Wushu Championship, Felicitated for Winning Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals
